when_to_say: Used to apologize or to get someone's attention.
example: すみません、ちょっと失礼します。 (Sumimasen, chotto shitsurei shimasu.) - Excuse me, I'll be right back.
こんにちは、ご機嫌いかがですか？ (Konnichiwa, gokigen ikaga desu ka?) - Good afternoon, how are you?

whenToUse: Used to describe something that is intricate or involved.
example: この問題はとても複雑です。 (Kono mondai wa totemo fukuzatsu desu.) - This problem is very complicated.

whenToUse: Used to describe something that is unclear or indefinite.
example: 彼の発言は曖昧だった。 (Kare no hatsugen wa aimaida.) - His statement was ambiguous.
はい、わかりました。 (Hai, wakarimashita.) - Yes, I understand.

whenToUse: Used to describe something that is difficult to perceive or express.
example: この料理の味は微妙です。 (Kono ryōri no aji wa bimyo desu.) - The taste of this dish is subtle.

word: ごめんなさい、遅れました
when_to_say: Used to apologize for being late.
example: ごめんなさい、遅れました。 (Gomennasai, okuremashita.) - I'm sorry, I'm late.

whenToUse: Used to discuss moral principles and values.
example: 倫理的な問題を考えなければならない。 (Rinriteki na mondai o kangaenakereba narimasen.) - We must consider ethical issues.
ごめんなさい、遅れました。 (Gomennasai, okuremashita.) - I'm sorry, I'm late.

when_to_say: Used to express the action of drinking.
example: 私は水を飲みます。 (Watashi wa mizu o nomimasu.) - I drink water.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a person one is friendly with.
example: 友達と遊びます。 (Tomodachi to asobimasu.) - I play with my friend.

when_to_say: Used to express disliking something or someone.
example: 私はピーマンが嫌いです。 (Watashi wa pīman ga kirai desu.) - I dislike bell peppers.

whenToUse: Used to describe something that is theoretical or conceptual.
example: 抽象的な概念を理解するのは難しい。 (Chūshōteki na gainen o rikai suru no wa muzukashii.) - It's difficult to understand abstract concepts.

when_to_say: Used to express strong liking for something or someone.
example: 私は猫が大好きです。 (Watashi wa neko ga daisuki desu.) - I love cats.

whenToUse: Used to describe a situation where two or more things are incompatible.
example: 彼の言動には矛盾がある。 (Kare no gendō ni wa mujun ga aru.) - There is a contradiction in his words and actions.

when_to_say: Used to express strong liking for something or someone.
example: 私は猫が大好きです。 (Watashi wa neko ga daisuki desu.) - I love cats.

whenToUse: Used to describe something that goes beyond ordinary limits or expectations.
example: 彼は超越的な能力を持っている。 (Kare wa chōetsu-teki na nōryoku o motte iru.) - He has extraordinary abilities.

whenToUse: Used to describe something that is not real or based on imagination.
example: それはただの幻想だ。 (Sore wa tada no gensō da.) - That's just an illusion.

whenToUse: Used to refer to the study of fundamental questions about existence, knowledge, and values.
example: 彼は哲学に興味を持っている。 (Kare wa tetsugaku ni kyōmi o motte iru.) - He is interested in philosophy.

whenToUse: Used to describe something that is mysterious or unexplained.
example: 宇宙は神秘に満ちている。 (Uchū wa shinpi ni michite iru.) - The universe is full of mysteries.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is dirty or unclean.
example: この服は汚いです。 (Kono fuku wa kitanai desu.) - This clothes is dirty.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is intricate or involved.
example: この問題はとても複雑です。 (Kono mondai wa totemo fukuzatsu desu.) - This problem is very complicated.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the branch of philosophy dealing with the nature of beauty, art, taste, and with the creation or appreciation of beauty.
example: 彼女は美学に興味を持っています。 (Kanojo wa bigaku ni kyōmi o motte imasu.) - She is interested in aesthetics.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the scientific study of celestial objects and phenomena.
example: 彼は天文学に興味を持っています。 (Kare wa tenmongaku ni kyōmi o motte imasu.) - He is interested in astronomy.

when_to_say: Used to describe something that is difficult to perceive or express.
example: この料理の味は微妙です。 (Kono ryōri no aji wa bimyo desu.) - The taste of this dish is subtle.
